node.title: Housing affordability at an all-time low - CoreLogic report
node.description: With the average property across New Zealand now costing 8.8 times the average household income, it would take households nearly 12 years to save for a deposit.

node.title: U.S. proposes limiting consideration of public benefits for green cards
node.description: The proposal is a stark departure from Trump-era public charge rules, which dramatically expanded the type and number of public benefits that would count against green card applicants.

node.title: Government Accountability Office says Capitol Police still need clearer steps for calling backup
node.description: The report said that on January 6, 2020, as the Capitol complex was overrun with rioters, Capitol Police struggled to secure outside backup due to obscure bureaucratic procedures.

node.title: Firefighters sue over protective gear, alleging it made them sick
node.description: Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances, also known as PFAS, are found in the turnout gear that is designed to protect firefighters.

node.title: UK pledges $50 million to enhance security in Indo-Pacific
node.description: Britain has committed £25 million ($NZ50.7m) to strengthen security in the Indo-Pacific as part of a pact with Australia, and leaders of both countries expressed "grave concerns" about China's…

node.title: Mount Maunganui businesses struggle with staff shortages
node.description: Cafes and restaurants in Mount Maunganui are run off their feet as they wait for the return of backpackers on working holidays to ease their staffing crisis.

node.title: Top U.S. diplomat in Ukraine urges Americans to leave "now"
node.description: "The situation could worsen very quickly, and we're very worried about that and are urging all Americans to leave the country," Chargé d'Affaires Kristina Kvien told CBS News.

node.title: US, NATO say Russia is building up troops near Ukraine, not withdrawing
node.description: The US and NATO say Russia is still building up troops around Ukraine despite Moscow's insistence it is pulling back, questioning President Vladimir Putin's stated desire to negotiate a solution to…

node.title: Oregon Supreme Court rules Nicholas Kristof cannot run for governor
node.description: Their decision comes after Oregon's Secretary of State found Kristof had not satisfied the state's residency requirement.

node.title: Tennessee residency program a win for future teachers and schools
node.description: The first-of-it-kind program allows teaching candidates to work full-time in the classroom while pursuing their degree — a win for future teachers and schools.

node.title: How the 10th day of protest outside Parliament unfolded
node.description: Police have pulled back on their plans to begin towing vehicles illegally parked around the anti-vaccine, anti-mandate protest on the grounds of Parliament.

node.title: Two New Zealanders into Olympic freeski final
node.description: The Porteous brothers, Nico and Miguel, have both qualified for the final of the men's freeski halfpipe in the Beijing Olympics.

node.title: Principal resigns after changing grades of dozens of students
node.description: An investigation found the Michigan high school principal changed the grades of dozens of students – including his own children.

node.title: 'Sheer confusion' in Queenstown with Omicron outbreak 'is unacceptable'
node.description: Queenstown's hospitality providers are calling for government support to survive the Omicron surge.

node.title: Ryan Fox overcomes the potential hurdle of his family name
node.description: Opinion - Hamish Bidwell admires golfer Ryan Fox for many reasons, but top of that list is for surviving being the son of All Black Grant Fox.

node.title: Positive test texts will heap 'more pressure' on Covid-19 cases - expert
node.description: A new online Ministry of Health system to notify people of positive Covid-19 tests and aid contact tracing needs to be streamlined, says a public health expert.

node.title: Mikaela Shiffrin finishes with no individual medals at Beijing Olympics
node.description: "I feel like a joke," Shiffrin said following her race.

node.title: Information warfare expert says U.S. is finally countering Russia at its own game
node.description: The head of an organization that's battled Russian disinformation in Ukraine for years tells CBS News the U.S. has finally learned to counter Putin's unique brand of hybrid warfare​.

node.title: Cricket: Henry scythes through Proteas batting lineup
node.description: Matt Henry produced a career-best 7 for 23 as New Zealand skittled South Africa for 95 to take charge of the opening test in Christchurch.

node.title: Health staff vote to strike twice next month after pay offer rejected
node.description: Laboratory workers, contact tracers and other critical health staff are planning to strike twice next month, after rejecting a pay offer from district health boards.

node.title: Motel emergency housing a 'stopgap measure', Ardern says
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says emergency accommodation is a "stopgap measure" and is concerned about its long-term social effects.

node.title: UK police to investigate Prince Charles' charity
node.description: The metropolitan police are investigating claims Prince Charles' charity offered honours help to a Saudi citizen.

node.title: Death toll from flooding and mudslides in Brazil passes 100
node.description: Almost 400 people were left homeless and 24 people were recovered alive, an official said.

node.title: Wall Street opens lower as investors eye Fed and Ukraine risks
node.description: Concerns about rising interest rates and potential conflict with Russia are weighing on sentiment.

node.title: Russia expels U.S. embassy's second-in-command amid Ukraine tensions
node.description: Bart Gorman, the U.S. deputy chief of mission to Russia, was expelled from the Russian capital on Thursday, the State Department said.

node.title: Inside the night that led to Kat West's mysterious death
node.description: Authorities who investigated the death of the 42-year-old stay-at-home mom retraced not only the night of her death, but also her online life.

node.title: Watch Live: Secretary of state speaks at U.N. on Russia's "threat to peace and security"
node.description: He is speaking as the U.S. says evidence shows Russia is "moving toward an imminent​" Ukraine invasion.

node.title: Watch Live: Amir Locke's funeral held at church in Minneapolis
node.description: The 22-year-old's death has provoked an outcry against no-knock warrants.

node.title: Jobless claims rise for the first time in a month
node.description: The number of Americans applying for unemployment aid ticked up, but economists say labor market remains healthy.

node.title: Millions in path of winter storm, forecast to bring "multiple hazards"
node.description: People from Oklahoma to Maine could get hit with wintry weather.
